chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 16 - Use/Threat of Force/Violence

result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Counts 1 & 2 are concurrent to each other.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not have contact with any victims, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorneys Michael Graveley and Jessica Krezjerak appeared for the State. DE appears in custody with Atty Christopher Glinski. DE's fiance present in court.  Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  1035 - PSI reviewed by all parties. Sentence recommendations. Family statement. Sentence:
Cts 1, 2:   Defendant is sentenced to 35 years in the WSP; 25 years Initial Confinement followed by 10 years of Extended Supervision - each count concurrent to the other.  DE (is not) eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
from Atty C Glinski with accompanying documents for consideration at sentencing.
Exhibits 1 & 39 were picked up KPD Officer Gaffney and returned to KPD Evidence Storage.

States Exhibits 2 thru 4, 6 thru 8, 10, 12 thru 14, 16, 18 thru 25, 32,  
Defense Exhibits 44, 45 and 47 thru 50

States Exhibits 1, 39 returned to KPD Evidence on 7/29/16

DAY 3 CONTINUED - Attorney Michael Graveley and Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Christopher Glinski.  Clerk: PT
Evidence is closed.  Jury instructions are given to the jurors  Closing arguments are made.  Alternate Juror  Kimberly R. is excused.  Jury begins deliberation at 11:55 AM and verdict reached at 3:19 PM.  Jury finds DE Guilty on both counts and jury is polled.  Jury released at 4:00 PM and State moves for judgment on the verdict.  DE is adjudged Guilty on both counts and bond is revoked at this time.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing on September 22, 2016 at 10:30 AM.

DAY 2 CONTINUED - Attorney Michael Graveley and Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Christopher Glinski.  Clerk: PT
Sworn in and testitifed are State's Witnesses: Desire C., Lia B., KPD Officer B. Miller and KPD Detective P. Patton.  Exhibits 1, 6, 7, 8, 10, 12, 13, 14, 16, 18 through 25, 32 and 47 through 50 are received.  State rests at 11:35 AM.  Court breaks for lunch and jurors are instructed to return at 1:20 PM.  Atty Graveley moves to amend Count 3 in 15CF1004 to "Theft from Person"; motion is granted.  Atty Glinksi moves for a directive verdict and motion is denied.  DE is advised of his rights and elects to not testify.  Sworn in and testified is Defense's Witness: Joyce G.  Exhibits 44 and 45 are received.  Defense rests.  State's rebutal witnesses:  Matthew R. Court breaks for the day at 2:45 PM and jurors are instructed to return at 9:05 AM.

Attorneys Michael Graveley and Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Christopher Glinski.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Opening instructions given by the Court and opening statements given by ADA Graveley.  Atty Glinski reserved his right to make an opening statement.  State witnesses testified:  Heidi B., KPD Sgt. James Krein, Rebecca R., Sharon P., Gregg K., Susan S., Louise P., and J.R.  State Exhibits 2, 3, 4, 39, 42, and 43 are received into evidence.  Trial to continue on 7/20/16 at 8:30.  Bond continued.

15CF1004 & 16CF44 - Judge Mary Wagner acting for Judge Schroeder.  Attorney Michael Graveley and Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Christopher Glinski.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  No objection by parties to Judge Wagner acting for Judge Schroeder.  Cases have been joined for trial.  Motions in limine heard and decided by the Court.  Jury selection held; 13 jurors selected.  Jury trial to begin on 7/19/16 at 9:00.  Bond continued.

Deft's Motion In Limine
Submitted by Atty Christopher Glinski
Due to Judge Schroeder's unavailability on July 18th (judicial education), Judge Wagner has agreed to handle this trial.  Attys notified July 7, 2016.

Minutes:  15CF1004/16CF44.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  DDA Graveley appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Christopher Glinski.  Cases are not resolved.  Leave on for trial for 7/18/16 @ 9am.  NOTE - Judge Schroeder will be attending a judicial conference on July 18th & July 19th; thus Judge Schroeder will attempt to locate another judge to hear this case on the scheduled date.  Alternatively, the court would be available to start the trial on Wed, July 20th.  Attys prefer to start the cases on July 18th due to scheduling conflicts with their calendars later in the week.  Attys will be notified via email whether another judge can be found to hear the cases on July 18th.
